data.description: The Software, Simulation, and Systems Engineering (S3E) Portfolio is seeking an Apprentice Geospatial Analyst (AGA) to support contracts centered on GEOINT data production for the National Geospatial Intelligence Agency. The S3E Portfolio provides geospatial intelligence support across a broad number of offices and agencies in the form of geospatial products, analysis, engineering and services.There is potential for this position to be supported remotely. Preference is to be in the Northern, VA or St. Louis, MO vicinity.Primary Responsibilities. The Apprentice GIS Analyst will provide the following:Support in geospatial analysis of satellite imagery to perform feature data extractionInteract daily with supervisors and/or functional peer groupsMust have ArcGIS experience, preferably with ArcGIS Pro, and an understanding of cartographic products, photo interpretation, and vector data editingExperience with Microsoft Office products including ExcelBasic Qualifications:High School Diploma with 0-3 years experienceUS Citizen is required (no dual citizenship, no Green Card)Entry level knowledge of GIS vector data, schema structures, and imagery exploitationESRI products including ArcGIS Pro. Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in GeographyIf you're looking for comfort, keep scrolling. At Leidos, we outthink, outbuild, and outpace the status quo — because the mission demands it. We're not hiring followers. We're recruiting the ones who disrupt, provoke, and refuse to fail. Step 10 is ancient history. We're already at step 30 — and moving faster than anyone else dares.Original Posting:December 17, 2025For U.S. Positions: While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.Pay Range:Pay Range $31,850.00 - $57,575.00The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.
requirements: Must have ArcGIS experience, preferably with ArcGIS Pro, and an understanding of cartographic products, photo interpretation, and vector data editing
High School Diploma with 0-3 years experience
US Citizen is required (no dual citizenship, no Green Card)
